business.headline: FICCI's Anant Goenka says trade diversification, reforms key amid global uncertaintyLooking ahead to the Union Budget, Goenka said 2025 saw strong government-led support for consumption through income tax changes and GST reforms.

India in a sweet spot despite US trade overhang, says CII President Rajiv MemaniReflecting on a year marked by trade disruptions and shifting geopolitical equations, Memani said India's policy resilience and reform momentum have kept the economy on firm footing.

EU, India close to sealing 'mother of all deals' worth a quarter of global GDPEuropean Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said negotiators had made substantial progress, but the deal still needed final work before both sides could seal it. "There is still work to do. But we are on the cusp of a historic trade agreement.

Trade disruption, energy realism and R&D push: Essar's Prashant Ruia at DavosAccording to Ruia, India's growth prospects remain strong, backed by its demographics, policy stability, entrepreneurial strength and prudent fiscal management.

From Tata to Infosys: Top Indian CEOs to meet Donald Trump at WEF DavosA delegation of prominent Indian corporate leaders is expected to attend the meeting, reflecting the country's strong representation at this year's World Economic Forum.

Sensex sinks over 1,000 points: 6 reasons behind today's stock market crashToday's stock market crash leaves the Sensex and Nifty at a knife's edge, and the next few sessions will decide whether this sell-off cools or spirals into something nastier.

Sensex ends 1,066 points lower, Nifty below 25,250; IT, auto stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,065.71 points to close at 82,180.47, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 353 points to end at 25,232.50. Both indices were down by over one percent at the closing bell.

Can India match China's manufacturing? Here's what it will takeSanjeev Krishan, chairperson of PwC in India, said India's industrial productivity is almost half of China's, and the gap exists not just in manufacturing but also in services.

PhonePe gets Sebi approval for IPO, targets $15 billion valuation: ReportThe Bengaluru-based company is now expected to move closer to the market with an IPO that could value it at around $15 billion.

Hybrid push, EV support, public transport: What auto sector wants from Budget 2026As Budget 2026 approaches, the auto sector is once again looking to the government for clear and practical policy support. Industry leaders say a stronger push for hybrids, electric vehicles and public transport could help balance sustainability with affordability.

Alchemy Capital launches Series 3 fund to tap India's next growth waveThe Series 3 fund will run for four years, with an option to extend by one more year. Investors will need to commit at least Rs 1 crore, which will be drawn in four parts of 25% each.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why the stock market fell todayAs of 3:30 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,065.71 points to 82,180.47. The NSE Nifty50 dropped 353 points to 25,232.50. Both indices were down by over one percent at the closing bell.

Retiring soon? Don't let these common tax blunders drain your savingsRetirement promises freedom and flexibility, but it also brings a quiet shift in how money is taxed. Small mistakes made during this transition can slowly drain your savings, often without you noticing until it is too late.

Gold, silver hit fresh highs: Will safe-haven demand keep driving gains?There is no stopping gold and silver. The two precious metals are on a roll, and experts say the rally may continue in the near term as global uncertainty keeps safe-haven demand elevated.

ITR refund delayed? Here's why it's stuck, how to check the status and whom to contactAn income tax refund delay can be frustrating, especially when everything seems in order. From data mismatches to bank account issues, even small errors can stop the refund from reaching your account on time.

Tariffs, tension and turbulence: Is it time to hit refresh on your stock investments?Global volatility may stay elevated, but investors can still stay on track by strengthening portfolios, adding quality stocks on dips, and avoiding emotional reactions. Resilience, not prediction, is the strategy that endures.

Why higher labour costs haven't hurt China's manufacturing leadManufacturing labour costs in China have risen sharply over the past three decades. By around 2022, Chinese factory wages were close to $8 per hour. In comparison, wages stood at about $2.3 per hour in Vietnam, $2.1 in Malaysia, $1.9 in Thailand and just $1.1 in India.

Sensex, Nifty open lower over weak global cues; IT and financials drag marketThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 269.93 points to 82,976.25, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 69.25 points to 25,516.25 as of 9:30 am.

Shadowfax IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPShadowfax Technologies IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 1,907.27 crores. The issue includes a fresh issue of 8.06 crore shares amounting to Rs 1,000.00 crores. It also has an offer for sale of 7.32 crore shares worth Rs 907.27 crores.

Not America, but Trump is definitely making gold great againUS President Donald Trump isn't making America great again, but he is unquestionably making gold greater than ever. As uncertainty deepens, the world's confidence is shifting from Washington to bullion.

entertainment.headline: Border 2 certified U/A 13+ with no cuts, new 'Braves Of The Soil' trailer released The new trailer of Sunny Deol's war-drama Border 2 pays an emotional homage to the Indian armed forces. The film has received a U/A 13+ CBFC certification.

David Beckham's rumoured ex Rebecca Loos backs Brooklyn: The truth always comes out David Beckham's rumoured ex Rebecca Loos backed Brooklyn. She also supported Brooklyn's wife Nicola Peltz in her social media comment.

Victoria Beckham memes go viral as social media riffs on Brooklyn's wedding remark Social media is flooded with memes of Victoria Beckham following son Brooklyn Beckham's claim that she danced "on him inappropriately" at his wedding.

Did Bhavana reject a Mammootty and Prithviraj film? Here's what she said Ahead of the release of Anomie, Bhavana has spoken about her extended absence from Malayalam cinema, saying the decision to step away was personal and unplanned.

David Beckham's 1st remark after son Brooklyn's bombshell: Children make mistakes David Beckham has issued a statement amid the ongoing family feud with son Brooklyn. David, without naming his son spoke about children learning from their own mistakes.

Dhurandhar is very well made: Javed Akhtar on why he personally called Aditya Dhar Javed Akhtar praised Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar and called it a great film. He revealed that he personally called Aditya Dhar to congratulate him.

Viral: Victoria Beckham gives cold vibes; avoids Nicola, son Brooklyn in old video Brooklyn Beckham pulled an uncomfortable Nicola Peltz into a family photo in a resurfaced red carpet video. The video is from the premiere of the Netflix documentary series Beckham.

Brooklyn vs Brand Beckham: Timeline of how family fallout played out in public A timeline of the Beckham family feud, from Brooklyn's wedding to Nicola Peltz to blocked accounts, legal notices and a widening family rift.

KL Rahul joins Border 2 trend, Ahan Shetty ups the challenge Cricketer KL Rahul has shown his support for actor and brother-in-law Ahan Shetty as Border 2 gears up for its theatrical release. He joined a social media trend, prompting a response from the latter.

Video: David Beckham ignores questions on son Brooklyn's bombshell post David Beckham remained silent and kept moving when questioned about his son Brooklyn's public statement regarding family tensions. He was attending the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Zakir Khan announces break from stand-up comedy for 3-5 years. Here's why Zakir Khan revealed during a live performance in Hyderabad that he will take a multi-year hiatus from comedy. The stand-up comedian is currently touring with his special Papa Yaar.

Vivek Oberoi denies Bollywood exit rumours, calls 2004 accident blip in career Vivek Oberoi addressed rumours about quitting the film industry, clarifying that his 2004 on-set accident did not affect his ability to perform physically demanding roles. The actor opened up about his recovery and the work he did thereafter.

Jana Nayagan makers cite Dhurandhar 2 in Madras High Court amid censor row The makers of Vijay's Jana Nayagan cited Dhurandhar 2 during a Madras High Court hearing amid a dispute with the CBFC over film certification, during an argument about announcing the release date before obtaining the certificate.

Border 2: After Dhuradhar and Ikkis, it's war on Pak for third time within weeks Amid Dhurandhar's success, the hype for Sunny Deol's sequel grows. The war-drama depicts India's response to Operation Changez Khan, while recently released titles like Ikkis and Dhurandhar revisit the 1971 conflict through diverse perspectives of covert intelligence and military bravery.

Shah Rukh Khan meets Katy Perry, Millie Bobby Brown, fans say 'never imagined' Images of Shah Rukh Khan meeting international celebrities, including Katy Perry, Millie Bobby Brown, and Lee Jung-jae, have gone viral. The photos are from the Joy Awards, which were recently held in Riyadh.

Jr NTR praises Dhandoraa, calls the Telugu social drama thought-provoking After finding new life on OTT, Murali Kanth's Dhandoraa earns appreciation from Jr NTR for its rooted storytelling and powerful performances.

Korean music label SM Entertainment sues X users over attacks on aespa, NCT WISH SM Entertainment initiated legal proceedings against individuals accused of posting malicious content about its artists on X and other platforms, as part of broader measures to safeguard its performers in 2026.

Boss is back: Allu Arjun lauds Chiranjeevi's Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu  As Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu continues its strong Sankranthi performance at the box office, Allu Arjun's emotional note praising the film and its superstar hero, Chiranjeevi, has added to the buzz.

Actor Durga Krishna says her marital life changed after baby: I felt invisible Malayalam actor Durga Krishna spoke openly about her postpartum experience, describing feelings of isolation and challenges in her marriage after the birth of her first child.

general news.headline: Fareed Zakaria on 'economy manager' Modi and how India should deal with Trump 2.0Geopolitical expert Fareed Zakaria has argued that India should respond to US President Donald Trump with patience and pragmatism rather than confrontation amid his tariff threats, stressing that "time is on India's side."

Usha Vance pregnant with fourth child, due in July, Vice President JD Vance announcesUS Vice President JD Vance and second lady Usha Vance announced they are expecting their fourth child, a baby boy due in July, sharing the news in a joint social media post.

Cigarette in hand, car at 140 kmph: Birthday thrill ride kills 4 friends in UdaipurThe accident occurred around 3 am on January 17 when six friends were travelling in a car. According to sources, the occupants pleaded for help for nearly 10 minutes after the crash. By the time people reached the spot, four of the friends had died.

How BJP, the party with a difference, became a party with deferenceThe world's biggest political party, the BJP, got a new president. Continuing with the parampara, no electoral contest was needed. That the BJP doesn't have a Shashi Tharoor-like leader is because it is no more the party with a difference, but one with deference.

NodeJS creator says era of humans writing code is overThe state of Vibe Coding in early 2026 is such that even seasoned software developers are now saying that the days of manually writing code are over. The latest in line to say this is NodeJS creator Ryan Dahl.

Is karma returning to bite Denmark?Denmark is seeking military backing from European Nato allies as US President Donald Trump seeks to take over Greenland, a Danish territory. However, Denmark itself had reportedly refused to back Nato member Greece against Turkey in 1974, saying the military alliance has no role in a crisis between its member states, according to ex-Greek minister Yanis Varoufakis.

Mad king element to Trump: Fareed Zakaria says US President acts on his whimsUS President Donald Trump is attempting to overturn decades of US foreign policy by acting on personal impulses rather than coherent strategy, geopolitical expert Fareed Zakaria said, warning of a "mad king element" in the way the Republican leader now wields power.

Green Lamborghini roars through Bengaluru traffic, reckless driving leads to FIRA green Lamborghini was seen swerving dangerously at high speed on a crowded street in Bengaluru, prompting the traffic police to register an FIR against the driver for reckless driving.

Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif inaugurates fake Pizza Hut in SialkotPakistan defence minister Khawaja Asif inaugurated a Pizza Hut outlet in Sialkot that was later declared unauthorised by the company, triggering social media backlash and prompting a trademark complaint by Pizza Hut Pakistan.

David Beckham's 1st remark after son Brooklyn's bombshell: Children make mistakesDavid Beckham has issued a statement amid the ongoing family feud with son Brooklyn. David, without naming his son spoke about children learning from their own mistakes.

India advises officials' families to return home ahead of Bangladesh electionsIndia advises families of officials in Bangladesh to return home as security concerns. The decision comes weeks ahead of the parliamentary elections scheduled to be held in Bangladesh.

Haryana man reaches Leh's highest point in Thar, pastes 'Gujjar' sticker on signboardA video showing a man from Haryana placing a Gujjar sticker on the milestone rock at Fotula Top, the highest point on the Leh-Srinagar road, has triggered public criticism and calls for action.

Mum danced very inappropriately on me: Son Brooklyn's damning post on BeckhamsBrooklyn Beckham has issued a detailed statement claiming that his parents, David and Victoria Beckham, attempted to control his life and harmed his relationship with his wife, Nicola Peltz.

Trump shares new map with Canada, Venezuela and Greenland as US territoryUS President Donald Trump shared an AI-generated map of the United States showing Canada, Greenland and Venezuela as part of American territory, a move that comes amid heightened tensions with European nations over Washington's push to bring Greenland under US control.

Ocean water close to Gujarat coast seen mysteriously boiling. Video hereThe government has initiated an investigation, and a team of Indian National Centre for Ocean Information Services has been deployed to look into the event.

Maggi, basmati rice, desi ghee: Army busts terror hideout deep inside J&K forestOfficials said that the supplies found at the hideout suggest the terrorists prepared for an extended stay in the dense forest. The terrorists remain at large with sources indicating they may have changed their location and fled towards adjoining hills. Efforts are ongoing to ensure the militants do not regroup in the region.

Kasab didn't commit contempt: Supreme Court raps Maneka Gandhi in dogs caseExpressing displeasure over her recent podcast, the Supreme Court said Maneka Gandhi made 'all kinds of comments' and also flagged the BJP leader's 'body language'.

Rs 21-crore Surat water tank collapses before inaugurationThe collapse has delivered a major setback to the project aimed at supplying drinking water to 33 villages in the Surat district. Locals allege that despite spending Rs 21 crore of public money, substandard materials were used, pointing towards large-scale corruption.

Governor Ravi walks out of assembly, says national anthem insulted, Stalin reactsTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi walked out of the assembly session on Tuesday after alleging the national anthem was insulted, and refusing to deliver a state government-prepared speech that he claimed carried "inaccuracies".
You won't believe what this cow did with a tool. Watch videoThe unlikely star of the study is Veronika, a 13-year-old Swiss Brown cow living in the alpine village of Nötsch in southern Austria.

Nobody wants him: Trump vows 200% wine tariffs after Macron's Peace Board snubThe Board of Peace initiative was first announced by Trump in September 2025 as part of a strategy to resolve the conflict in Gaza. Since then, the administration has expanded the initiative's scope, inviting world leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, to join efforts to address a range of global conflicts.

Zakir Khan announces break from stand-up comedy for 3-5 years. Here's whyZakir Khan revealed during a live performance in Hyderabad that he will take a multi-year hiatus from comedy. The stand-up comedian is currently touring with his special Papa Yaar.

China will replace Harvard's scientific crown, and India has no seat at the table yetHandcrafted ByOur Editors This isn't about rankings, but about who gets to write the rules of the future. While China is positioning itself to take Harvard's place in global science, India is left to choose between building its own research power, or staying a dependent player in someone else's Cold War.

sports.headline: Day 4 Live Updates: Alcaraz, Sabalenka and Gauff headline 2nd round action Australian Open 2026 Day 4 Live Updates: Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and Coco Gauff headline Day 4 of the Australian Open 2026 as the second round begins in Melbourne, with several top seeds and Indian doubles pair Yuki Bhambri in action.

IND vs NZ, 1st T20I predicted XI: Ishan Kishan at No.3 but will India go spin-heavy? IND vs NZ, 1st T20I Predicted XI: Ishan Kishan is set to return at No.3 for India in the 1st T20I against New Zealand, while the hosts debate going spin-heavy or backing Harshit Rana as they fine-tune plans for the 2026 World Cup.

Jemimah stands tall as Delhi Capitals beat Mumbai Indians to stay in playoff race DC vs MI, WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues struck an unbeaten fifty to steer Delhi Capitals past Mumbai Indians by seven wickets, surviving a tense middle phase and late drama to keep their playoff hopes alive in Vadodara.

Out or not out? Third umpire's delayed decision on Lizelle Lee stumping confuses fans WPL 2026, MI vs DC: Lizelle Lee's stumping triggered a five-minute third-umpire review and a storm of reactions online, with fans split over whether she was really out as controversy overshadowed her fluent knock.

Australian Open 2026: Jannik Sinner cruises to round 2, Osaka made to work hard Jannik Sinner started his Australian Open 2026 campaign with a two-sets win over Hugo Gaston, who had to retire due to an injury. Naomi Osaka made a fashion statement on Tuesday, but was made to work hard to progress to round two in Melbourne.

After Australian Open loss, Oliynykova delivers moving tribute and plea for Ukraine Australian Open 2026: Oleksandra Oliynykova used a post-match T-shirt at the Australian Open to send a quiet plea for Ukraine, honouring her soldier father and finding a powerful voice beyond the tennis result.

Pole vaulter dismisses Railways clarification over Panvel station ordeal A day after he and his coach were forced to deboard a train at Panvel Railway Station for carrying sports equipment, India's national record holder in pole vault, Dev Kumar Meena, has dismissed the Railways' clarification over the incident.

India vs New Zealand T20I series: Full schedule, squads, live-streaming details India and New Zealand are all set to lock horns ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 in an exciting five-match series, starting from January 21. Here's all you need to know about the five-match series.

India women's team to tour South Africa for 5 T20Is before T20 World Cup 2026 South Africa will host India for a five-match women's T20I series in April 2026, with matches set for Durban, Johannesburg, and Benoni. The series serves as preparation for both teams ahead of the ICC Women's T20 World Cup.

DC vs MI: 16-year-old Deeya Yadav becomes youngest-ever WPL debutant Sixteen-year-old Deeya Yadav, popularly known as 'Chhoti Shafali', became the youngest player ever to debut in the Women's Premier League. Meanwhile, Mumbai Indians also handed a WPL debut to Vaishnavi Sharma in their group-stage clash.

Not safe for me to answer: Bangladesh captain avoids T20 World Cup question Bangladesh captain Litton Das avoided a question about T20 World Cup, saying that it isn't safe for him to answer the query at the moment.

Suryakumar Yadav shrugs off form concerns: Not playing tennis, this is a team sportIND vs NZ: India T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav plays down his lean patch ahead of the New Zealand series, saying team success matters more than personal milestones as India build towards the 2026 World Cup.

DC vs MI Highlights, WPL 2026: Jemimah guides Delhi to thrilling winDelhi Capitals (DC) vs Mumbai Indians (MI) Highlights, WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues' fifty has helped Delhi snap their losing streak and get back to winning ways in the WPL 2026. MI slumped to their third loss on the trot and will need to quickly recoup as their play-off hopes are under threat.

IND vs NZ: Ishan Kishan set for T20I return after 785 days, confirms SuryakumarIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav has confirmed Ishan Kishan's return to the national side for the first T20I against New Zealand in Raipur on January 21.

Pole vault coach begs TTE with folded hands: A viral image that spoke of neglectA viral video of a coach begging at Panvel station has exposed the six-hour ordeal faced by India's top pole vaulters, sparking outrage over how the system treats athletes on their journey to glory.

Asif Nazrul Warns ICC: 'We Will Not Bow Down To Conditions Imposed At The Behest Of The BCCI'On this Special Report, the focus is on the escalating tension between Bangladesh and the International Cricket Council (ICC) regarding the upcoming T20 World Cup. Bangladesh Sports Advisor Asif Nazrul has issued a stern warning, stating that the nation 'will not bow down to any conditions imposed by the ICC at the behest of the BCCI.' The dispute centers on Bangladesh's refusal to play matches in India, citing security concerns and an 'anti-Bangladesh environment.' While speculation suggests the ICC might replace Bangladesh with Scotland, the Bangladesh interim government remains firm on its demand to move fixtures to Sri Lanka. The programme explores the potential impact on the tournament as a January 21 deadline approaches. India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy provides analysis on the back-pressure being created by the Bangladesh Cricket Board and the ICC's impending decision on the matter.

Naomi Osaka creates stir at Australian Open with unique outfit, video goes viralNaomi Osaka turned heads at the Australian Open as she arrived in a striking ocean-blue tie-dye outfit before her first-round clash against Antonia Ruzic.

Want Mitchell to replicate heroics in T20Is: Santner confident after ODI series winNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner is confident middle-order batter Daryl Mitchell will replicate his ODI form in the five-match T20I series against India.

T20 World Cup: Bangladesh won't bow down to pressure from BCCI or ICC, says sports advisorT20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh have warned the ICC they will not accept pressure or "unreasonable conditions" over playing T20 World Cup matches in India, as the standoff with the BCCI intensifies.

G Kamilini ruled out due to injury, MI name Vaishnavi Sharma as replacementMumbai Indians' wicketkeeper-batter Gunalan Kamilini is ruled out of WPL 2026 due to injury. Left-arm spinner Vaishnavi Sharma has been signed as her replacement for the rest of the season.

Gael Monfils bids emotional farewell to Australian Open after two decadesGael Monfils waved an emotional goodbye to the Australian Open after losing to Dane Sweeny in his final appearance at the tournament before retirement.

Indian-origin Nishesh Basavareddy, 20, wins maiden Grand Slam matchAustralian Open 2026: 20-year-old Indian-origin American, Nishesh Basavareddy, won his maiden Grand Slam main draw match, beating Australian Christopher O'Connell in a five-set marathon on Tuesday, January 20.

India series will offer perfect preparation for T20 World Cup: Lockie FergusonNew Zealand fast bowler Lockie Ferguson reckons the five-match T20I series against India, beginning Wednesday, will serve as ideal preparation for next month's T20 World Cup.

Bangladesh cricket in freefall, turning into never-ending circus of chaos Bangladesh cricket has spiralled into a self-made crisis, where chaos, controversy and administrative failure have consistently overshadowed the game itself, even on the eve of the T20 World Cup.

Clarke to stay with NZ squad for three T20Is as injury cover for BracewellNew Zealand pacer Kristian Clarke will remain with the squad as injury cover for Michael Bracewell during the five-match T20I series against India. Bracewell's participation, meanwhile, will depend on his recovery from a minor left-calf strain sustained during the third ODI in Indore.

Virat and Rohit likely to be demoted, BCCI may scrap top contract bracketThe Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee has suggested removing the top bracket, the A-plus category, from the annual retainership contracts. As a result, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are likely to be demoted to the B category, having featured in only one format of international cricket since January 2025.

Hardik Pandya surprises RCB's Gautami Nayak following her maiden WPL fiftyHardik Pandya surprised Gautami Naik with a congratulatory message after her maiden fifty in WPL 2026. Naik notched up a brilliant half-century against Gujarat Giants (GG), scoring 73 off 55 balls with the help of seven fours and six sixes in her innings.

Ricky Ponting's love for The Undertaker: How a WWE poster chokeslammed his bad luckRicky Ponting's passion for wrestling great, The Undertaker, sparked a unique superstition during his cricket career. This quirky ritual coincided with his prolific run-scoring, revealed his former teammate Jason Gillespie.

Quiet bat, loud rumours: Why Rohit Sharma can't afford another poor ODI seriesStar India batter Rohit Sharma finds himself at a crucial juncture in his career, following his poor show in the New Zealand series. As he turns 39 this year, the margin of error would be nil for the India star with Yashasvi Jaiswal eagerly waiting for his opportunity on the bench.

Has Alcaraz copied Djokovic's serve? Serbian great jokes about copyright claimAustralian Open 2026: Novak Djokovic joked about Carlos Alcaraz's serve motion being similar to his own. The Serb spoke about the similarities in their serves after his dominant first-round win at Melbourne Park.

Zadran, Rasooli star as Afghanistan stun West Indies ahead of T20 World CupAfghanistan gave West Indies a reality check with a 38-run win in the first T20I in Dubai ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. West Indies were restricted to 143/9 in their 20 overs, chasing a target of 182.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
